content:
SecurityTokenHandlerConfigurationElement Class

Definition

Represents a <securityTokenHandlerConfiguration> element in a configuration file.

In this Article

public sealed class SecurityTokenHandlerConfigurationElement : System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement
Inheritance
Object
ConfigurationElement
SecurityTokenHandlerConfigurationElement

Remarks

The <securityTokenHandlerConfiguration> element provides default configuration settings for the collection of security token handlers configured under a <securityTokenHandlers> element. The <securityTokenHandlers> element is represented by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Configuration.SecurityTokenHandlerElement> class.

Constructors

SecurityTokenHandlerConfigurationElement()

Initializes a new instance of the SecurityTokenHandlerConfigurationElement class.

public SecurityTokenHandlerConfigurationElement ();

Properties

AudienceUris

Gets the AudienceUriElementCollection that is associated with this token handler configuration element.

public System.IdentityModel.Configuration.AudienceUriElementCollection AudienceUris { get; }
Value
AudienceUriElementCollection

The collection of audience URIs that are configured for this token handler configuration element.

Attributes
ConfigurationPropertyAttribute

Remarks

Corresponds to the <audienceUris> element that is configured under the <securityTokenHandlerConfiguration> element.

Caches

Gets or sets the IdentityModelCachesElement that is associated with this token handler configuration element.

public System.IdentityModel.Configuration.IdentityModelCachesElement Caches { get; set; }
Value
IdentityModelCachesElement

The element that configures the token replay cache and the session security token cache for this token handler configuration element.

Attributes
ConfigurationPropertyAttribute

Remarks

Corresponds to the <caches> element that is configured under the <securityTokenHandlerConfiguration> element.

CertificateValidation

Gets or sets the X509CertificateValidationElement that is associated with this token handler configuration element.

public System.IdentityModel.Configuration.X509CertificateValidationElement CertificateValidation { get; set; }
Value
X509CertificateValidationElement

The element that configures the certificate validator and its properties for this token handler configuration element.

Attributes
ConfigurationPropertyAttribute

Remarks

Corresponds to the <certificateValidator> element that is configured under the <securityTokenHandlerConfiguration> element.

IssuerNameRegistry

Gets or sets the IssuerNameRegistryElement that is associated with this token handler configuration element.

public System.IdentityModel.Configuration.IssuerNameRegistryElement IssuerNameRegistry { get; set; }
Value
IssuerNameRegistryElement

The element that configures the issuer name registry for this token handler configuration element.

Attributes
ConfigurationPropertyAttribute

Remarks

Corresponds to the <issuerNameRegistry> element that is configured under the <securityTokenHandlerConfiguration> element.

IssuerTokenResolver

Gets or sets the issuer token resolver that is associated with this token handler configuration element.

public System.IdentityModel.Configuration.CustomTypeElement IssuerTokenResolver { get; set; }
Value
CustomTypeElement

A custom type element that specifies the Type of the issuer token resolver. The type must derive from SecurityTokenResolver.

Attributes
ConfigurationPropertyAttribute

Remarks

Corresponds to the <issuerTokenResolver> element that is configured under the <securityTokenHandlerConfiguration> element. The <issuerTokenResolver> element registers an issuer token resolver. This can be used to resolve Issuer key identifier clauses while deserializing a SAML token.

MaximumClockSkew

Gets or sets the maximum clock skew that is configured for this token handler configuration element.

public TimeSpan MaximumClockSkew { get; set; }
Value
TimeSpan

The maximum clock skew.

Attributes
TypeConverterAttribute ConfigurationPropertyAttribute

Remarks

Corresponds to the maxClockSkew attribute of the <securityTokenHandlerConfiguration> element.

Name

Gets or sets the name of the token handler configuration element.

public string Name { get; set; }
Value
String

The name of the identity configuration.

Attributes
ConfigurationPropertyAttribute StringValidatorAttribute

Remarks

Corresponds to the name attribute of the <securityTokenHandlerConfiguration> element.

Properties 

protected override System.Configuration.ConfigurationPropertyCollection Properties { get; }
Value
ConfigurationPropertyCollection

To be added.

SaveBootstrapContext

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to save the bootstrap context in claims identities and session security tokens created by the handlers configured in this identity collection.

public bool SaveBootstrapContext { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true to save the BootstrapContext; otherwise, false.

Attributes
ConfigurationPropertyAttribute

Remarks

Corresponds to the saveBootstrapContext attribute of the <securityTokenHandlerConfiguration> element.

ServiceTokenResolver

Gets or sets the service token resolver that is associated with this token handler configuration element.

public System.IdentityModel.Configuration.CustomTypeElement ServiceTokenResolver { get; set; }
Value
CustomTypeElement

A custom type element that specifies the Type of the service token resolver. The type must derive from SecurityTokenResolver.

Attributes
ConfigurationPropertyAttribute

Remarks

Corresponds to the <serviceTokenResolver> element that is configured under the <securityTokenHandlerConfiguration> element. The <serviceTokenResolver> element registers a service token resolver. This can be used to resolve Issuer key identifier clauses while deserializing a SAML token.

TokenReplayDetection

Gets or sets the TokenReplayDetectionElement that is associated with this token handler configuration element.

public System.IdentityModel.Configuration.TokenReplayDetectionElement TokenReplayDetection { get; set; }
Value
TokenReplayDetectionElement

The element that specifies whether token replay detection is enabled and specifies the maximum expiration period for tokens in the token replay cache.

Attributes
ConfigurationPropertyAttribute

Methods

Init() 

protected override void Init ();
